class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">PartialCaptureTransactionInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Top-level input fields for capturing outstanding funds authorized by a transaction.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">clientMutationId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a transaction being created (in any status), then the same transaction in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no transaction is created, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transactionId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>ID of the original authorized transaction to be partially captured.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transaction<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput" class="graphref__inputValue">PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput</a></span><br/><p><p>Input fields for the capture, with details that will define the resulting capture transaction.</p></p></span></li></ul></div></div><hr style="margin-top:3rem"/></div><div id="Input--PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput" style="padding:2rem"><a href="#Input--PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput" data-algolia="fieldTypeLabel" class="graphref__linkHeading"><strong class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Input fields for the capture, with details that will define the resulting capture transaction.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">amount<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--Amount" class="graphref__inputValue">Amount!</a></span><br/><p><p>The amount to capture on the transaction against the parent authorization transaction. Must be greater than 0. You can perform multiple partial capture transactions as long as the cumulative amount of those transactions is less than or equal to the amount authorized by the parent transaction. You can&#x27;t capture more than the authorized amount unless your industry and processor support settlement adjustment (capturing a certain percentage over the authorized amount); <a href="https://help.braintreepayments.com?issue=TransactionProcessingQuestion" target="_blank">contact us for assistance</a>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">discountAmount<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>Discount amount that was included in the total transaction amount. Does not add to the total amount the payment method will be charged. This value can&#x27;t be negative. Please note that this field is not on PayPal transactions.</p><p><em>Required for Level 3 processing</em>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">finalCapture<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--Boolean" class="graphref__inputValue">Boolean</a></span><br/><p><p>Input to specify current partial capture is the final one for parent authorized transaction.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">lineItems<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--TransactionLineItemInput" class="graphref__inputValue">[TransactionLineItemInput!]</a></span><br/><p><p>Line items for this transaction. Up to 249 line items may be specified.</p><p><em>Required for Level 3 processing</em>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">orderId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>Additional information about the transaction. On PayPal transactions, this field maps to the PayPal invoice number. PayPal invoice numbers must be unique in your PayPal business account. Maximum 255 characters or 127 for PayPal transactions. If specified, this will update the existing order ID on the transaction.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">purchaseOrderNumber<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>A purchase order identification value you associate with this transaction.</p><p><em>Required for Level 2 processing</em>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">shipping<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--TransactionShippingInput" class="graphref__inputValue">TransactionShippingInput</a></span><br/><p><p>Shipping information.</p><p><em>Required for Level 3 processing</em>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">tax<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--TransactionTaxInput" class="graphref__inputValue">TransactionTaxInput</a></span><br/><p><p>Tax information about the transaction.</p><p><em>Required for Level 2 processing</em>.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">descriptor<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--TransactionDescriptorInput" class="graphref__inputValue">TransactionDescriptorInput</a></span><br/><p><p>Fields used to define what will appear on a customer&#x27;s bank statement for a specific purchase. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a refund being created (in any status), then the same refund in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. transaction.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">clientMutationId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a refund being created (in any status), then the same refund in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no refund is created, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transactionId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>The ID of a transaction to be refunded.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">refund<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Input--RefundInput" class="graphref__inputValue">RefundInput</a></span><br/><p><p>Input fields for the details of the refund.</p></p></span></li></ul></div></div><hr style="margin-top:3rem"/></div><div id="Input--RefundUsBankAccountInput" style="padding:2rem"><a href="#Input--RefundUsBankAccountInput" data-algolia="fieldTypeLabel" class="graphref__linkHeading"><strong class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">RefundUsBankAccountInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Top-level input fields for creating a detached refund on a US Bank Account.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">clientMutationId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a transaction being created (in any status), then the same transaction in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no transaction is created, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transactionId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>The ID of the transaction to reverse.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">emvData<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String!</a></span><br/><p><p>EMV data received from a payment reader to be included as part of the reversal.</p></p></span></li></ul></div></div><hr style="margin-top:3rem"/></div><div id="Input--ReverseRefundInput" style="padding:2rem"><a href="#Input--ReverseRefundInput" data-algolia="fieldTypeLabel" class="graphref__linkHeading"><strong class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">ReverseRefundInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Input fields for reversing a refund.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">clientMutationId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a refund being created (in any status), then the same refund in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no refund is created, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">refundId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>The ID of the refund to reverse.</p></p></span></li></ul></div></div><hr style="margin-top:3rem"/></div><div id="Input--ReverseTransactionInput" style="padding:2rem"><a href="#Input--ReverseTransactionInput" data-algolia="fieldTypeLabel" class="graphref__linkHeading"><strong class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">ReverseTransactionInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Input fields for reversing a transaction.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">clientMutationId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a transaction or refund being created (in any status), then the same transaction or refund in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no transaction or refund is created, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transactionId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>The ID of the transaction to reverse.</p></p></span></li></ul></div></div><hr style="margin-top:3rem"/></div><div id="Input--RiskDataInput" style="padding:2rem"><a href="#Input--RiskDataInput" data-algolia="fieldTypeLabel" class="graphref__linkHeading"><strong class="graphref__fieldTypeLabel">RiskDataInput</strong></a><div data-algolia="fieldDescription"><div class="graphref__fieldDescription"><p><p>Input fields for data used by processors for risk analysis.</p></p></div></div><div><div><span class="graphref__typeListLabel">input:</span><ul style="padding-left:.5rem"><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">customerBrowser<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>The User-Agent header provided by the customer&#x27;s browser, which gives information about the browser. href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">apiRequestKey<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--String" class="graphref__inputValue">String</a></span><br/><p><p>An identifier to detect duplicate operations and prevent double-processing. This can be used to protect from submitting a duplicate request; for instance, after receiving an INTERNAL error where the ultimate state of the request is uncertain.</p><p>If a request is made with a new <code>apiRequestKey</code>, it will be processed as normal. If subsequent requests are made with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code>, and the first request resulted in a transaction being voided (in any status), then the same transaction in its current status will be returned.</p><p>Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must have the same input values as the original request. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> must also be made after the initial request completes, and before 30 days has elapsed since the initial request finished. If a subsequent request is made while the first is in-flight or with different input values than the original request, it will result in a <code>VALIDATION</code> error on the subsequent request. If an <code>apiRequestKey</code> is reused after 30 days since its first use, it will be treated as if it has not been used before.</p><p>If an initial request is made with an <code>apiRequestKey</code>, but the request receives a <code>AUTHENTICATION</code>, <code>AUTHORIZATION</code>, <code>NOT_FOUND</code>, <code>RESOURCE_LIMIT</code>, or <code>NOT_IMPLEMENTED</code> error, and no transaction is voided, then no duplication will be considered. Subsequent requests with the same <code>apiRequestKey</code> will be treated as non-duplicate requests, just as if they were the first request with that value.</p></p></span></li><li style="margin-bottom:.5rem"><span><span style="font-weight:500">transactionId<!-- -->:<!-- --> <a href="#Scalar--ID" class="graphref__inputValue">ID!</a></span><br/><p><p>The ID of the transaction to
